result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Georgio M Deleon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Georgio M Deleon in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Ricci in court for Georgio M Deleon.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Ricci in court for Georgio M Deleon.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial. Defense advises of possible resolution. Court sets plea hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp. 10/26/2022

Defendant Georgio M Deleon in court with Attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Georgio M Deleon in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Sanchez- Alcantar. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion and Notice of Motion for Dismissal from Defendant ( Georgia Deleon #2022004484- House of Corrections 8885 S 68 th Street, Franklin, WI 53132)

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, in custody at HOC.  Catelin Ringersma on behalf of Daniel Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  SPD has appointed counsel prior to hearing. Court finds good CAUSE to extend the preliminary hearing deadline. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD status of counsel report filed.
Received and Filed
Received and Filed

Defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in Br. 4.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness persent. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bail Hearing exhibits from 4/14/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 780
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Georgio M. Deleon - #2022004484, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

09:46 AM Defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders cash bail with GPS $15,000.00 cash bail turn over to justice point (level 5) with home confinement (no release).Court orders $20,000.00 cash bail turnover to justice point (level 5) without GPS with home confinement(no release). Defendant should be placed on GPS waiting list if posting $20,000.00.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Georgio M Deleon not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to state's bail motion. State offers exhibit 1 and request to play video file in court. Court grants and receives exhibit 1. Court orders state to file exhibit one with court by 4-15-2022. Court orders $20,000.00 cash bail turnover to justice point (level 5) without GPS with home confinement(no release). Defendant should be placed on GPS waiting list. Bail with GPS $15,000.00 cash bail turn over to justice point (level 5) with home confinement (no release). Case remains set for prelim in prelim court.
Notice of State's Objection to Bail Set in ICCR and Request for Immediate Relief.

Defendant Georgio M Deleon in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Georgio M Deleon in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Georgio M Deleon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so. There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with N.J.N.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
